page.syntax: Result as P = a5_SQL_ImportDataSource(P ds ,C tablename [,L AddTableToDatabase [,* arguments [,* options [,* openConnection [,L showProgress [,L allowCancel ]]]]]])

argument.name: Result
argument.description: A dot variable that describes the result of the operation.

item.name: .error
item.description: L .T. indicates that an error occurred

item.name: .errorText
item.description: C A text description of any error that occurred.

argument.name: ds
argument.description: A dot variable that describes the data to be retrieved. See Data Source Data Structure.

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: Optional. The name of the table to refresh. The path of the current database is assumed.

argument.name: arguments
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL_VALUE(). Arguments that retrieve value(s) from variable(s) or prompts for value(s) at runtime. Only applicable to SQL Reports. Refer to SQL::Arguments Object.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL_VALUE(). Sets filter (WHERE) and order (ORDER BY) expressions for a query against a passive-linked table. A pointer dot variable with 2 elements. Refer to Using the Options Argument.

item.name: .filter
item.description: C Adds to the WHERE clause in the underlying SQL expression.

item.name: .order
item.description: C Replaces the ORDER BY clause in the underlying SQL expression.

page.description: Imports a DataSource definition as a native Alpha Five table.
page.discussion: The A5_SQL_ImportDataSource() function imports the data specified by a Data Source name to an Alpha Anywhere table.
